citations.narrative:
The facility used to have a computerized method of maintaining acquisition records for puppies, however a change over to
paper records has led to incomplete acquisition information for puppies from small unlicensed breeders. Acquisition
records must be kept on APHIS 7005 Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand unless a variance-approved
computerized record-keeping system is used. Complete acquisition records are required and can be important for animal
health tracing if needed.
***Correct from 3/8/2024 forward.
APHIS 7006 for 5 puppies sold to a pet store on 3/17/2023 was not available for inspection. The licensee thinks that it
was misplaced and that a copy can be acquired from the pet store. APHIS 7006 is a required form to maintain on file for
dogs sold for at least one year after sale. Ensure to maintain a copies of APHIS 7006 for each dog/puppy disposition.
***Correct from 3/8/2024 forward.

citations.desc: Procurement of dogs, cats, and other animals; dealers.
citations.narrative:
Acquisition for puppies bought from small unlicensed breeders certifying that they maintain 4 or fewer breeding female
dogs/cats and the dogs/cats were born and raised on that person's premises haven't been regularly obtained and kept by
the facility. The licensee reports that they do verify this information from any unlicensed breeder they buy from; but
regulations require that certification is obtained. When acquiring any dog/cat from any person not licensed with USDA,
ensure to obtain certification that the animals were born and raised on that person's premises and that the person does
not maintain more than four breeding female dogs and/or cats.
***To be corrected from 3/8/2024 forward.

The written contingency plan/disaster plan that the facility used to have in place was not available for inspection. A
documented contingency plan is required and can be important to prepare for possible emergencies. Ensure to develop
and document a contingency plan that can be followed if needed and review the plan at least once a year.
***Correct by 4/18/2024.

A written Exercise Program that is approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) was not available for inspection. An
exercise program that is approved by the AV helps ensure dogs have adequate space and opportunity for exercise.
Ensure to work with the AV to get a written exercise program approved.
***Correct by 4/12/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility used to have a computerized method of maintaining acquisition records for puppies, however a change over to 
paper records has led to incomplete acquisition information for puppies from small unlicensed breeders. Acquisition 
records must be kept on APHIS 7005 Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand unless a variance-approved 
computerized record-keeping system is used. Complete acquisition records are required and can be important for animal 
health tracing if needed.  
***Correct from 3/8/2024 forward. 
 
APHIS 7006 for 5 puppies sold to a pet store on 3/17/2023 was not available for inspection. The licensee thinks that it 
was misplaced and that a copy can be acquired from the pet store. APHIS 7006 is a required form to maintain on file for 
dogs sold for at least one year after sale. Ensure to maintain a copies of APHIS 7006 for each dog/puppy disposition. 
***Correct from 3/8/2024 forward. 
2.132(d) 
   
Procurement of dogs, cats, and other animals; dealers. 
Acquisition for puppies bought from small unlicensed breeders certifying that they maintain 4 or fewer breeding female 
dogs/cats and the dogs/cats were born and raised on that person's premises haven't been regularly obtained and kept by 
the facility. The licensee reports that they do verify this information from any unlicensed breeder they buy from; but 
regulations require that certification is obtained. When acquiring any dog/cat from any person not licensed with USDA, 
ensure to obtain certification that the animals were born and raised on that person's premises and that the person does 
not maintain more than four breeding female dogs and/or cats. 
***To be corrected from 3/8/2024 forward. 
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
The written contingency plan/disaster plan that the facility used to have in place was not available for inspection. A 
documented contingency plan is required and can be important to prepare for possible emergencies. Ensure to develop 
and document a contingency plan that can be followed if needed and review the plan at least once a year.  
***Correct by 4/18/2024.

3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
A written Exercise Program that is approved by the attending veterinarian (AV) was not available for inspection. An 
exercise program that is approved by the AV helps ensure dogs have adequate space and opportunity for exercise. 
Ensure to work with the AV to get a written exercise program approved.  
***Correct by 4/12/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
